feed.title: Lareau Lab
feed.subtitle: The Lareau Laboratory for Computational and Systems Immunology is in the csBio Program at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center, New York, NY.

entry.title: HHV6 meeting in Japan!
entry.content: Caleb and Erin attend the 12th International Conference on HHV-6 and HHV-7 in Himeji, Japan. Congratulations to Erin for winning an abstract award!
entry.summary: Caleb and Erin attend the 12th International Conference on HHV-6 and HHV-7 in Himeji, Japan. Congratulations to Erin for winning an abstract award!

entry.title: Caleb is awarded the Michelson prize!

link.title: Caleb is awarded the Michelson prize!

entry.content: Caleb is one of three winners of the Michelson Prize in Systems Immunology. This award will directly fund our research on the evolving blood virome and its impact on human disease. Thank you to the Human Immunome Project and Michelson Medical Research Foundation for this amazing honor! Read more about the awardees here.
entry.summary: Caleb is one of three winners of the Michelson Prize in Systems Immunology. This award will directly fund our research on the evolving blood virome and its impact on human disease. Thank you to the Human Immunome Project and Michelson Medical Research Foundation for this amazing honor! Read more about the awardees here.

entry.title: The Lab’s work on the virome is highlighted!

link.title: The Lab’s work on the virome is highlighted!

entry.content: Erin and Caleb sat down with our colleague Ian Demsky to discuss the lab’s on going work to study the human virome. This includes highlighting our new U01 grant to study the virome comprehensively using large datasets. Check out the full story here!
entry.summary: Erin and Caleb sat down with our colleague Ian Demsky to discuss the lab’s on going work to study the human virome. This includes highlighting our new U01 grant to study the virome comprehensively using large datasets. Check out the full story here!

entry.title: PERFF-seq out in Nature Genetics!
entry.content: The finalized manuscript describing PERFF-seq is online today in Nature Genetics. A PDF is available here. Congrats Tsion, Benan, and all of our wonderful collaborators! Check out our landing page on PERFF-seq here and the Nature Genetics News and Views from the Shaffer Lab here.
entry.summary: The finalized manuscript describing PERFF-seq is online today in Nature Genetics. A PDF is available here. Congrats Tsion, Benan, and all of our wonderful collaborators! Check out our landing page on PERFF-seq here and the Nature Genetics News and Views from the Shaffer Lab here.

entry.title: Highly cited researcher
entry.content: Caleb is recognized as one of Clarivate’s Highly Cited Researchers in 2024 as a Cross-Field Category. We appreciate the support and recognition of the impact of our work!
entry.summary: Caleb is recognized as one of Clarivate’s Highly Cited Researchers in 2024 as a Cross-Field Category. We appreciate the support and recognition of the impact of our work!

entry.title: Funniest lab costumes!
entry.content: At the Annual MSK IGO open house, our crew dressed up as Rick and Morty’s (and portals). We were voted the funniest group costume–that means a free pizza party! Thanks to our friends at IGO!!
entry.summary: At the Annual MSK IGO open house, our crew dressed up as Rick and Morty’s (and portals). We were voted the funniest group costume–that means a free pizza party! Thanks to our friends at IGO!!

entry.title: New grant to study the human virome awarded!

link.title: New grant to study the human virome awarded!

entry.content: The lab receives its first independent grant to study the Human Virome from the National Center for Complementary and Integrative Health and the NIH Office of Director. This support will allow the lab to pursue its most ambitious research related to human viruses. Stay tuned for more!
entry.summary: The lab receives its first independent grant to study the Human Virome from the National Center for Complementary and Integrative Health and the NIH Office of Director. This support will allow the lab to pursue its most ambitious research related to human viruses. Stay tuned for more!

entry.title: Erin wins the people’s choice award at the MSK postdoc slam!

link.title: Erin wins the people’s choice award at the MSK postdoc slam!

entry.content: Congrats to Erin for winning the People’s Choice Award at the MSKCC postdoc slam competition. Erin presented a verbal summary of her work studying how the same infections can influence individuals differently, including HHV-6 that can be transmitted through the germline.
entry.summary: Congrats to Erin for winning the People’s Choice Award at the MSKCC postdoc slam competition. Erin presented a verbal summary of her work studying how the same infections can influence individuals differently, including HHV-6 that can be transmitted through the germline.

entry.title: Review paper on single-cell technology development

link.title: Review paper on single-cell technology development

entry.content: The first review paper from the lab is out in Trends in Biotechnology that explores key concepts in technology development for droplet-based single-cell assays. Congratulations to Arthur for leading the writing and framing this article! You can find the manuscript online here.
entry.summary: The first review paper from the lab is out in Trends in Biotechnology that explores key concepts in technology development for droplet-based single-cell assays. Congratulations to Arthur for leading the writing and framing this article! You can find the manuscript online here.

entry.title: Review on mitochondrial genetics and single cell is online!

link.title: Review on mitochondrial genetics and single cell is online!

entry.content: A collaborative review article written with the Leif Ludwig Lab is online today at Nature Genetics. The review summaries the rapid deveopment of new technologies for single-cell genomics that have specifically informed a new era of studying mitochondrial genetics. Let us know what you think!
entry.summary: A collaborative review article written with the Leif Ludwig Lab is online today at Nature Genetics. The review summaries the rapid deveopment of new technologies for single-cell genomics that have specifically informed a new era of studying mitochondrial genetics. Let us know what you think!
